intro: Schoenoxiphium clarkeanum, commonly known as the Clarke's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its compact, succulent-like appearance with small, fleshy leaves and yellowish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
